definition: new policy/New Deal (Roosevelt's 1933 policy to deal with the Great Depression)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
failed reform of Northern Song government in 1043
Hu-Wen New Administration (formed in 2003), ostensibly reform-oriented leadership of Hu Jintao 胡錦濤|胡锦涛[Hu2 Jin3 tao1] and Wen Jiabao 溫家寶|温家宝[Wen1 Jia1 bao3]

sentences.english: It's got a new government, you know, which hasn't governed before.
sentences.chinese: 它刚换了政府，一个从未执政过的新政府。

sentences.english: The new government imposed a special tax  on imported wines.
sentences.chinese: 新政府对进口酒征收特别税。

sentences.english: Japan's new government Poodle or Pekinese?
sentences.chinese: 日本新政府到底是狮子狗还是京巴？

sentences.english: The new government will then deliver its policy statement before parliament.
sentences.chinese: 然后，新政府将在国会之前递交其政策声明。

sentences.english: In area under Kulun Amban's jurisdiction, the New Policy progressed much.
sentences.chinese: 库伦办事大臣辖区的新政进展较大。

sentences.english: The reasons for the new American austerity are subtler, but not shocking.
sentences.chinese: 美国紧缩新政的原因更为微妙，但并不令人吃惊。

sentences.english: Decades elapsed between successful abolitionism and New Deal reforms.
sentences.chinese: 几十年过去了之间的成功废除主义和新政改革。

sentences.english: What adjustment do you think the new UK Government will make to UK-China relations?
sentences.chinese: 你认为新政府将在哪些方面调整对华关系？

sentences.english: To be sure, the administration inherited this structural mess from the other guys.
sentences.chinese: 当然，新政府是从其他人那里继承了这种结构性混乱。

sentences.english: Instead, they turned town centres into no-go areas on Friday and Saturday nights.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这一新政却让市中心在周末的晚上成了危险区。

sentences.english: After building up Sichuan provincial government, Liu Xiang began to reorganize grass root administrative staff.
sentences.chinese: 四川新政府成立后，即着手整顿基层行政人员。

sentences.english: We need a New Deal for Global Food Policy.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个“全球食品政策新政”。

sentences.english: The new authorities there want to put Mr al-Mahmoudi on trial.
sentences.chinese: 利比亚新政府欲对马哈茂迪进行审判。

sentences.english: Wisconsin supplied more manpower to the New Deal than any other university.
sentences.chinese: 威斯康星给新政所提供的人力比其他任何大学都要多。

sentences.english: After consolidating his position, F.D.R. opened the New Deal floodgates.
sentences.chinese: 地位得到巩固之后，罗斯福打开了新政的闸门。

sentences.english: They were busy canvassing and drumming up sentiment against the new government.
sentences.chinese: 他们当时正忙于游说，挑起对新政府的不满情绪。

definition: to officially launch (a policy, program etc)/to appear on stage/to appear publicly/(of a bar girl) to leave with a client
to put into effect/to carry out
to put in place/to put into practice/to take effect
soccer association/soccer federation/abbr. for 足球協會|足球协会[zu2 qiu2 xie2 hui4]
to issue/to proclaim/to enact (laws, decrees etc)
The higher ups have policies while the lower downs have their own ways of getting around them. (idiom)
pinyin: shang4 you3 zheng4 ce4 , xia4 you3 dui4 ce4
